main.docTitle: Hotel and Guesthouse Accommodation (Appeal Board) Regulations

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Hotel and Guesthouse Accommodation (Appeal Board) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: appellant (上訴人) means a person who gives the Convenor a notice of appeal under section 17C of the Ordinance; (6 of 2020 s. 29)
specified form (指明表格) means a form specified by the Convenor under regulation 16. (6 of 2020 s. 29)

section.name: s4
section.heading: Notifying Authority and interested persons of appeal

subsection.leadIn: An appellant must, on the date the notice of appeal is given to the Convenor under section 17C of the Ordinance, also serve the following documents on the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the notice of appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of all documents accompanying the notice of appeal as mentioned in section 17C(3)(c) and (d) of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Convenor must, as soon as reasonably practicable after receiving the notice of appeal, notify every interested person as defined by section 12P(6) of the Ordinance (except the appellant) that the Convenor has received the notice.

A party to an appeal (requesting party) may, within the period specified in subregulation (2), serve a notice on the other party (requested party) requesting any further particulars relating to the appeal that are specified in the notice (requested particulars).

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of 7 days after the date on which a copy of the notice of appeal is served on the Authority under regulation 4(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the longer period that the relevant authority may, on an application made in the specified form, allow in a particular case.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subregulation (5), the requested party must, within the period specified in subregulation (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give the requested particulars to the requesting party; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give a copy of the requested particulars to the relevant authority.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of 7 days after the date on which a notice is served on the requested party under subregulation (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the longer period that the relevant authority may, on an application made in the specified form, allow in a particular case.

subsection.leadIn: The relevant authority may, on application, direct that the requested party need not comply with subregulation (3) in respect of a requested particular (exempted particular) if it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the request for the exempted particular was unreasonable; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reasonable grounds exist for not giving the exempted particular.

subsection.def: relevant authority (有關當局) means—(a)the chairperson of the appeal board formed to hear the appeal; or(b)if an appeal board has yet to be formed—the Convenor.

subsection.leadIn: A party to an appeal (requesting party) may, at any time, serve a notice on the other party (requested party) requiring the requested party to, within 7 days after the date on which the notice is served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce any document relating to the appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permit the requesting party to make any copy of the document.

subsection.content: If a requested party fails to comply with a notice served under subregulation (1) in respect of a document, the party is not allowed to subsequently use the document as evidence at the appeal hearing, unless the party satisfies the appeal board that the party had a reasonable cause for the failure to comply.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Date, time and place of hearing

subsection.content: The chairperson of an appeal board must, as soon as reasonably practicable after the board is formed, fix the date, time and place for hearing the appeal.
The chairperson must also notify, in the specified form, every party to the appeal of the date, time and place of the hearing at least 28 days before the date fixed.
A party to an appeal may apply, in the specified form, to the chairperson of the appeal board for the board to summon a person as a witness.

subsection.leadIn: If an appeal board decides (whether or not on application) to summon a person as a witness, the notice required under section 17D(8)(c) of the Ordinance must be given—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the chairperson of the board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the specified form.

subsection.def: summon (傳召) means summon under section 17D(8)(c) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Appeal to be conducted in public
section.content: The hearing of an appeal by an appeal board is to be conducted in public unless the chairperson of the board, of his or her own motion or at the request of the appellant or the Authority, orders that all or any persons should be excluded from the whole or any part of the hearing.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Representation
section.leadIn: At the hearing of an appeal— (6 of 2020 s. 33)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appellant may be represented by a legal practitioner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority may be represented by a legal practitioner, or a legal officer as defined by section 2 of the Legal Officers Ordinance (Cap. 87).

subsection.leadIn: An appellant may abandon the whole or any part of an appeal by giving a written notice to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson of the appeal board formed to hear the appeal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an appeal board has yet to be formed—the Convenor.

subsection.content: The appellant must, on the date the notice is given under subregulation (1), also serve a copy of the notice on the Authority.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Failure of appellant to attend hearing

subsection.leadIn: If, on the day and time fixed for hearing an appeal, the appellant fails to attend the hearing either in person or by a legal practitioner, the appeal board may—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: proceed to hear the appeal; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: dismiss the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: If an appeal is dismissed by an appeal board under subregulation (1)(c)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appellant may, within 30 days after the date on which the order for dismissal is made, apply for a review of the order by giving a written notice to the chairperson of the board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the board may, if satisfied that the failure to attend was because of sickness or other reasonable cause, set aside the order.

subsection.content: The appellant must, on the date the notice is given under subregulation (2)(a), also serve a copy of the notice on the Authority.

If an appeal board sets aside an order for dismissal under subregulation (2)(b), the chairperson of the board must, as soon as reasonably practicable after the setting aside of the order, fix the date, time and place for hearing the appeal afresh.
The chairperson must also notify, in the specified form, every party to the appeal of the date, time and place of the hearing at least 14 days before the date fixed.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Failure of appellant to serve notice of appeal, etc.
section.content: If an appellant fails to comply with regulation 4(1) or 5(3), the appeal board may dismiss the appeal.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Record of proceedings
section.leadIn: The chairperson of an appeal board must take or cause to be taken in writing a full minute, so far as circumstances permit, of the following matters in respect of an appeal— (6 of 2020 s. 35)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the grounds of the appeal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the appellant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of any person who appears as a witness for the appellant;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name of any person who appears as a witness for the Authority;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: the evidence of any person who gives evidence;

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: the amount of any sum awarded under section 17D(8)(e) of the Ordinance in respect of the costs involved in the appeal; and the name of the person in favour of whom the award was made. (6 of 2020 s. 35)

section.name: s15
section.heading: Service of notices and other documents
section.leadIn: A notice or any other document permitted or required to be served on a person under these regulations may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: served personally on the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sent to the person by registered post at the person’s address last known to the sender.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Convenor may specify forms
section.content: The Convenor may specify a form to be used for the purposes of any matter provided for under these regulations.
